symptom: Chest pain (angina), shortness of breath, fatigue, heart attack.
Often asymptomatic; severe cases may cause headaches, dizziness, or nosebleeds.
Severe chest pain, pain in the left arm, jaw, or back, shortness of breath, sweating, nausea.
Sudden numbness or weakness in the face, arm, or leg (especially on one side), confusion, trouble speaking or seeing, severe headache.
Shortness of breath, fatigue, weakness, swelling (edema) in legs, ankles, and feet, rapid or irregular heartbeat.
Fluttering in the chest, racing heartbeat (tachycardia), slow heartbeat (bradycardia), chest pain, dizziness.
Irregular and often rapid heart rate, palpitations, weakness, shortness of breath, lightheadedness.
Painful cramping in hip, thigh, or calf muscles after activity (claudication), leg numbness, coldness in lower leg or foot.
Often asymptomatic until rupture; deep, constant pain in abdomen or back, a pulsating feeling near the navel.
Breathlessness with exertion or even at rest, swelling of the legs, ankles and feet, fatigue, irregular heartbeats.
Fever, painful and tender joints, shortness of breath, chest pain, fatigue.
Varies widely; may include abnormal heart rhythms, blue-tinged skin (cyanosis), shortness of breath, swelling.
Heart murmur, shortness of breath, fatigue, chest pain, dizziness, fainting.
Swelling in the affected leg, pain or tenderness in the leg, a feeling of warmth, red or discolored skin.
Sudden shortness of breath, sharp chest pain that is worse with a deep breath, cough that may produce bloody sputum.
Squeezing, pressure, heaviness, tightness, or pain in the chest, often triggered by physical activity or stress.
Slow heart rate (less than 60 bpm), fainting, dizziness, fatigue, shortness of breath.
Fast heart rate (more than 100 bpm), shortness of breath, lightheadedness, rapid pulse, heart palpitations.
Sudden collapse, loss of consciousness, no pulse. It is a medical emergency.
Fever, chills, fatigue, aching joints and muscles, night sweats, a new or changed heart murmur.
Chest pain, rapid or abnormal heart rhythms, shortness of breath at rest or during activity, fatigue.
Sharp, stabbing chest pain that may feel better when sitting up and leaning forward; fever, weakness.
Depends on which arteries are affected; can lead to angina, claudication, or symptoms of a stroke or heart attack.
Generally no symptoms; detected by a blood test. Can lead to atherosclerosis.
Tall, thin build, long arms, legs, and fingers. Heart problems include risk of aortic aneurysm and valve malformations.
High fever, rash, swelling of hands and feet, irritation and redness of the eyes, inflammation of the mouth, lips, and throat.
Irregular heartbeats, fainting, seizures. Often occurs during rest or sleep. Can cause sudden death.
Fainting, seizures, and sudden death, often triggered by exercise or stress.
Rapid breathing, severe shortness of breath, sudden rapid heartbeat, loss of consciousness, weak pulse, low blood pressure.
Chest pain, feeling faint or dizzy with activity, shortness of breath, fatigue.
Often asymptomatic; may cause palpitations, shortness of breath, chest pain, fatigue.
Heart murmur, shortness of breath, fatigue, lightheadedness, swelling in feet or ankles.
Fatigue and weakness with activity, shortness of breath, fainting, irregular pulse.
Active pulsing in the neck veins, fatigue, swelling in the abdomen, legs, or feet.
Heart murmur, shortness of breath, chest pain, fainting, fatigue.
Usually no symptoms; in some cases, it's linked to migraine with aura and stroke.
Shortness of breath, fatigue, swelling of legs, feet or abdomen, heart palpitations.
Poor eating, failure to thrive (in infants), fast breathing or breathlessness, easy tiring.
Bluish coloration of the skin (cyanosis), shortness of breath and rapid breathing, especially during feeding or exercise.
Blue color of the skin (cyanosis), shortness of breath, poor feeding, weak pulse. Appears at birth or very soon after.
Cyanosis, rapid, difficult breathing, poor feeding, cold hands and feet. Appears within hours of birth.
Fatigue, unintentional weight loss, general aches and pains, dizziness, high blood pressure, weak pulse in the arms.
Persistent headache, scalp tenderness, jaw pain when chewing, fever, fatigue, vision problems.
Pain in hands and feet, which may be severe; pale, red, or bluish hands or feet; cold hands or feet.
Fingers and toes turn white, then blue, and feel numb and cold in response to cold temperatures or stress.
Lightheadedness, fainting, and an uncomfortable, rapid increase in heartbeat upon standing up.
Low blood pressure, distended neck veins, anxiety, chest pain radiating to neck, shoulders, or back, trouble breathing.
Chest pain and pressure (angina), shortness of breath, dizziness, fainting, swelling in legs and feet.
Fatigue, shortness of breath, reduced ability to exercise, swelling in legs, ankles, feet, and abdomen.
Shortness of breath, chest pain (especially with exercise), fainting, sensation of rapid, fluttering heartbeats (palpitations).
